thread.title: Bike rider narrowly escape path of V/Line train at Ballan | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Bike rider narrowly escape path of V/Line train at Ballan | Daily Mail Online

author: Chris Pleasance For Daily Mail Australia
title: Bike rider narrowly escape path of V/Line train at Ballan | Daily Mail Online
text: This is the terrifying moment a biker narrowly avoided certain death after leaping out of the way of a high-speed train. Driver Colin Sharp captured the dramatic footage on camera near Ballan, Victoria, before uploading it online. Mr Sharp said the train was traveling at 160km/h when he spotted the rider and had no time to stop. This is the moment a biker was almost killed after falling off in the middle of train tracks in Victoria before a speeding locomotive appeared He told 3AW he initially thought he had hit the man, and only later discovered the rider had escaped uninjured. Footage shows the train hurling along the tracks before a man appears in the middle of the rails up ahead. The rider appears to have fallen off his bike while in the middle of the tracks and was trying to retrieve his bike when the train appeared. RELATED ARTICLES
